description: Rodrigo and Gracey start off as the major candidates in this single-winner election.
Polls prior to the election show Gracey having a noticeable lead.
But some voters are not interested in either candidate.
If Rodrigo and Gracey are clustered too closely on the ideological spectrum, another party can enter from the right to secure voters who may not have participated before.
Members of Rodrigo's base who voted for him because he was the most right-leaning candidate now have incentive to switch.
Some of Rodrigo's supporters also have incentive to switch to Gracey if they'd rather elect her than Belinda.
Rodrigo is likely to drop out of the race. The field ends much more polarized than it started, which is characteristic of FPTP.
